summary: The Safe and Smart Federal Purchasing Act (S. 1592) mandates the Director of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to review the impact of the "lowest price technically acceptable" (LPTA) source selection process on national security. The review will assess procurement practices of Defense and Civilian agencies to identify potential national security risks arising from these practices. The Director is required to submit a report detailing the review's findings to the relevant House and Senate committees within 180 days of the Act's enactment.
